Major_Arcs.title: Saloon Scene and Initial Relationship Conflicts
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc establishes the setting in a saloon and introduces initial conflicts related to relationships and personal explanations.

sub_scenes.title: Saloon Scene Setting and Blonde Woman's Explanation
sub_scenes.description: The story begins by setting the scene in a saloon and introducing a dialogue between a blonde woman and an off-panel man.

narrative_arcs.title: Saloon Scene Setting
The Blonde Woman's Explanation
Conversation Continues - Man's Response and Old Timers' Wisdom

Major_Arcs.title: Ghost Town, Airport Plans and Emotional Reactions
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts to Page 2 and introduces the Ghost Town setting and the conflict arising from plans to build an airport, highlighting the emotional responses of characters.

sub_scenes.title: Cowboy's Farewell and Modern Arrival
sub_scenes.description: A cowboy departs reflecting on the past glory of Ghost Town, contrasted by the arrival of modern surveyors with plans for an airport.

narrative_arcs.title: Cowboy's Farewell and Nostalgic Reflection
Modern Arrival and Ghost Town Observation
Airport Plan and Town Demolition Imminent
Emotional Reaction to Ghost Town's Destruction

Major_Arcs.title: Relationship Conflict and Reaction to Ghost Town Demolition
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc on Page 3 focuses on personal relationship conflicts between Nan and Cal, and continues the emotional reactions to the Ghost Town demolition.

sub_scenes.title: Nan and Cal's Argument and Woman's Outburst at Demolition
sub_scenes.description: Nan and Cal argue about romantic understanding, while a surveyor woman reacts intensely to the Ghost Town's demolition.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Accusation and Cal's Defense
Woman's Reflection on Past Relationship with Cal
Ghost Town Demolition and Woman's Outburst

Major_Arcs.title: Business Discussions, Father-Daughter Conflict and Reassurance
Major_Arcs.description: Major arc on page 4 and 5 shifts to business matters concerning cattle and the airport, and delves into family conflicts and attempts at romantic reassurance.

sub_scenes.title: Cattle Shipping, Father-Daughter Argument and Parental Reassurance
sub_scenes.description: Business discussions about cattle shipping and airport plans lead to conflict between Nan and her father, followed by parental and maid's reassurance about Cal's love.

narrative_arcs.title: Cattle Shipping and Airport Business Discussion
Horses for Construction and Father-Daughter Conflict
Reassurance of Cal's Love
Nan's Resolve to Seek Clarity
Chasing Cal
Horse Business Interruption
Business Deal and Commitment

Major_Arcs.title: Romantic Conflict, Departure, Longing and Reconciliation
Major_Arcs.description: Major arc spans pages 6 and 7, detailing a romantic conflict between Nan and Cal, his departure, Nan's longing, and eventual reconciliation amidst a snowstorm crisis.

sub_scenes.title: Intense Conversation, Cal's Departure and Nan's Longing
sub_scenes.description: Nan and Cal have a heated discussion leading to Cal's departure and Nan experiencing longing during his absence.

narrative_arcs.title: Intense Conversation and Impending Departure
Cal's Departure
Reaction to Departing Horses
Time Skip and Nan's Longing Narration
Cal's Return and Confession of Love
Reunion and Unease in the Snow

sub_scenes.title: Snowstorm Arrival and Livestock Crisis leading to Romantic Reassurance
sub_scenes.description: Arrival at a snowy homestead and a severe weather report lead to concerns about livestock and fodder, culminating in romantic reassurance amidst the crisis.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at the Snowy Homestead and Weather Report
Concern Over Livestock and Fodder Shortage
Assessing the Snow's Severity and Nan's Concern
Narrative Description of Relentless Snowfall
Cal's Decisive Action to Save the Cattle
Indoor Despair and a Glimmer of Hope
Plane Arrives with Fodder
Hope and Romantic Reassurance

Major_Arcs.title: Cowtown Showdown and Critique of Heroism
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc on page 9 focuses on a showdown in Cowtown and the contrasting reactions and critiques of the involved character, Chane Benson.

sub_scenes.title: Showdown in Cowtown and Public Reactions
sub_scenes.description: A showdown in Cowtown involving Chane Benson is observed and debated by onlookers with varied opinions on his character and actions.

narrative_arcs.title: Showdown and Reactions in Cowtown
Debate on Chane Benson's Character
Dismissive Reaction and Age Critique

Major_Arcs.title: Jeff's Gun Obsession and Sally's Intervention
Major_Arcs.description: Major arc on page 10 delves into Jeff's gun obsession, Sally's attempts to intervene, and introduces Clyde Surratt and a violent threat.

sub_scenes.title: Sally's Concern, Confrontation and Jeff's Violent Boasting
sub_scenes.description: Sally reflects on Jeff's childhood, critiques his gun obsession, confronts him, and Jeff reveals his admiration for Clyde Surratt culminating in a violent threat.

narrative_arcs.title: Reminiscing About Jeff's Childhood
Gun Obsession Critique
Confrontation over Gun Cleaning
Lectures and Disobedience
Plea for Decency
Clyde Surratt Admiration
Boasting and Challenge to Clyde Surratt
Violent Threat and Laughter

Major_Arcs.title: Planning to Help Jeff and Introduction of Shane Benson
Major_Arcs.description: Major arc on page 11 focuses on Sally and Pete's plan to help Jeff and introduces Mr. Benson, highlighting the unsettling nature of Chane/Shane Benson.

sub_scenes.title: Planning Intervention and Shane Benson's Demeanor
sub_scenes.description: Sally and Pete plan to help Jeff, reaffirm their love, and Sally introduces Mr. Benson, followed by a narrative reflection on Shane Benson's unsettling demeanor.

narrative_arcs.title: Planning to Help Jeff
Reaffirming Love and Duty Towards Jeff
Introduction of Mr. Benson and Sarcastic Remark
Narrative Reflection on Shane Benson's Demeanor

Major_Arcs.title: Article Conflict, Fear and Benson's Response
Major_Arcs.description: Major arc on page 12 focuses on the conflict arising from Clyde's article about Chane Benson, Sally's fear, and Benson's unexpected reaction and justification for staying in town.

sub_scenes.title: Article Confrontation and Benson's Decision to Stay
sub_scenes.description: A woman confronts Clyde about his article on Benson, Sally expresses fear, Clyde reassures her, and Benson confronts Sally and Surrett explaining why he's staying.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation about the Article
Sally's Fear and Clyde's Reassurance
Benson's Confrontation and Justification for Staying

Major_Arcs.title: Debate on Benson, Dinner Invitation and Moonlight Walk
Major_Arcs.description: Major arc spans pages 13 and 14, focusing on debating Benson's character, deciding to invite him for dinner, leading to a seemingly polite moonlight walk that turns confrontational.

sub_scenes.title: Debate on Benson and Dinner Invitation
sub_scenes.description: Surrett and Sally discuss Clyde's article, consider inviting Benson for dinner to understand him better, and debate his skills and intentions.

narrative_arcs.title: Benson Justifies His Stance and Criticizes Clyde
Sally and Surrett Discuss Clyde's Article and Benson's Impact

Discussing Chane's Skills and Dinner Invitation
Polite Conversation and Departure for Moonlight Walk

sub_scenes.title: Jealous Confrontation and Violent Kiss
sub_scenes.description: Jeff confronts Sally and Chane in jealousy, leading to escalating aggression and an unwanted kiss.

narrative_arcs.title: Jeff's Jealous Confrontation
Escalating Aggression and Unwanted Kiss
Sally's Angry Retort and Accusations

Major_Arcs.title: Aftermath of Violence and Chase to Newspaper Office
Major_Arcs.description: Major arc on page 15 deals with the aftermath of the violent kiss, Chane's retaliation, and the urgent chase to save Clyde at the newspaper office.

sub_scenes.title: Post-Kiss Conversation, Retaliation and Ride to Town
sub_scenes.description: Sally and Jeff discuss the kiss, Chane retaliates against Jeff, Sally becomes enraged and they urgently ride to town to save Clyde.

narrative_arcs.title: Post-Kiss Conversation and Jeff's Justification
Chane's Retaliation and Threat, Sally's Urgent Plea
Desperate Ride to Save Clyde
Confrontation Inside the Newspaper Office

Major_Arcs.title: Newspaper Office Showdown, Headline Change and Partnership
Major_Arcs.description: Major arc on page 16 concludes the newspaper office confrontation, orders a headline change and flashes back to show the positive outcome of a newspaper partnership.

sub_scenes.title: Showdown Outside and Inside Newspaper Office and Flashback to Partnership
sub_scenes.description: Confrontation outside the newspaper office leads to Chane leaving with Clyde, followed by anxious waiting, a headline change order, and a flashback to the newspaper partnership.

narrative_arcs.title: Benson's Challenge and Chane's Departure with Clyde
Anxious Wait and Sally's Regret
Headline Change Order
Newspaper Partnership and Sally's Pride

Major_Arcs.title: Ranch Troubles and Introduction of New Boss
Major_Arcs.description: Major arc on page 17 introduces new ranch setting, a physical confrontation, and the arrival of a new boss, Steve Daley, with mixed reactions.

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Confrontation and Introduction of Steve Daley
sub_scenes.description: A ranch confrontation occurs, followed by the introduction of Steve Daley as the new boss, met with some skepticism and anticipation of trouble.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation and Gender Insult
Introduction of Steve Daley as the Boss
Discussion of Trouble with the New Boss

Major_Arcs.title: Betsy's Unease, Ranch Problems and Town Trip Planning
Major_Arcs.description: Major arc on page 18 focuses on Betsy's unease with Steve, discussion of ranch problems, and planning a trip to town with Hank's mysterious orders.

sub_scenes.title: Betsy's Unease and Ranch Troubles leading to Town Trip Plan
sub_scenes.description: Betsy expresses unease with Steve, discusses ranch troubles with Hank, leading to a plan for a trip to town with Hank giving Betsy unusual orders.

narrative_arcs.title: Initial Interaction and Betsy's Unease with Steve
Ranch Troubles and Suspicions of Double K
Trip to Town and Hank's Orders for Betsy

Major_Arcs.title: Town Confrontation, Bar Fight and Betsy's Ranch Decision
Major_Arcs.description: Major arc on page 19 and 20 features a confrontation in town, a separate bar fight incident, and Betsy's crucial decision regarding Steve's employment at the ranch.

sub_scenes.title: Town Confrontation and Bar Fight Incident
sub_scenes.description: Betsy is confronted in town by Fred Bridges, and a separate bar fight incident occurs involving different characters.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation with Fred Bridges at the Store
Bar Fight and Aftermath

sub_scenes.title: Betsy's Ranch Decision and Change of Heart
sub_scenes.description: Betsy realizes Steve's nature, initially decides to fire him but changes her mind after talking to Hank.

narrative_arcs.title: Betsy's Realization about Steve and Ranch Decision
Betsy's Change of Heart and Hank's Suggestion

Major_Arcs.title: Betsy's Confession, Romantic Dilemma and Gun Surrender
Major_Arcs.description: Major arc on page 20 and 21 highlights Betsy's confession of love to Steve, her difficult request, and Steve's ultimate decision to prove his love.

sub_scenes.title: Love Confession and Gun Dilemma
sub_scenes.description: Betsy confesses love to Steve leading to a negotiation about his gunfighter identity and a difficult request.

narrative_arcs.title: Betsy's Confession to Steve
Negotiating Terms and Gunfighter Identity
Love Confession and a Difficult Request
The Ultimate Proof of Love and a Kiss

Major_Arcs.title: Ranch Conflict Escalation and Betsy's Firm Stance
Major_Arcs.description: Major arc on page 22 focuses on escalating ranch conflicts, accusations from Old Man Bridges, and Betsy's firm stance and reflection on violence.

sub_scenes.title: Accusations, Threats and Betsy's Determination
sub_scenes.description: Old Man Bridges accuses Betsy, escalating into threats and Betsy asserting her firm stance and reflecting on the impending violence.

Reflection on Violence and Foreshadowing of Attack

Major_Arcs.title: Impending Conflict at Devil's Pass and Resolution
Major_Arcs.description: Major arc on page 23 and 24 deals with the escalating conflict at Devil's Pass, Betsy's attempts to intervene and the violent but resolved confrontation.

sub_scenes.description: Betsy pleads with Hank and Steve, rides to Devil's Pass, leading to a violent confrontation and its aftermath.

Major_Arcs.title: Rancher's Fence Conflict and Resolution
Major_Arcs.description: Major arc on page 25 and 26 details the conflict arising from the new fence built by neighbors, escalating confrontation and eventual expulsion of Fred Gordon and his brother.

sub_scenes.description: Dave's sulking, flashback to Curley's arrival about the fence, ranchers discussing the fence, confrontation at fence line, planning herd management, escalating tension, Curley's intervention and expulsion of Gordons.

Major_Arcs.title: Love Triangle Resolution and Marriage Proposal
Major_Arcs.description: Major arc on page 27 and 28 resolves the love triangle between Carrie, Dave and Fred, culminating in Fred and Carrie's engagement.

sub_scenes.description: Carrie and Dave discuss Fred, Carrie confesses conflicted feelings, leading to Fred's interruption and eventual resolution and marriage proposal.

Major_Arcs.title: Business Dealings, Carrie's Accusation and Dave's Plea
Major_Arcs.description: Major arc on page 29 focuses on business implications of the marriage, Carrie's angry accusation towards Dave, and his desperate plea.

sub_scenes.title: Business Justifications and Carrie's Angry Reaction
sub_scenes.description: Fred explains business motivations, Carrie reacts angrily accusing Dave of trickery, and Dave desperately pleads.

Major_Arcs.title: Carlton Confrontation and Emotional Reconciliation
Major_Arcs.description: Major arc on page 30 resolves the Carlton contract conflict, leading to Carrie's emotional breakdown and ultimate reconciliation with Dave.

sub_scenes.title: Carlton Confrontation and Emotional Resolution
sub_scenes.description: Carrie prepares for and directly confronts Mr. Carlton, leading to emotional aftermath and reconciliation with Dave.

Major_Arcs.title: Moving On and Lingering Feelings
Major_Arcs.description: Major arc on page 31 focuses on Carrie moving on, expressing lingering pain from Fred's actions but affirming her decision to leave the West.

sub_scenes.title: Carrie's Decision to Leave and Distant Reunion with Dave
sub_scenes.description: Carrie expresses her decision to leave, despite lingering pain, and has a distant reunion with Dave in town.

narrative_arcs.title: Relief and Lingering Pain After Decision

Riding Back and Discussing Past and Present Feelings

Major_Arcs.title: Dirk's Injury, Capture and Rance's Recovery leading to Proposal
Major_Arcs.description: Major arc spans pages 32 to 39, detailing Dirk's injury, Marshal's arrival and pursuit, Rance's injury and eventual recovery, culminating in a marriage proposal.

Major_Arcs.title: Wedding Day Disruption and Final Resolution
Major_Arcs.description: Major arc on page 40 concludes the narrative with wedding day preparations, Dirk's dramatic interruption, his capture, backstory reveal, and final romantic resolution.
